list-item.p: We analyzed terrestrial carbon fluxes as simulated by an earth system model over the last 1,000 years to study the variability across timescales
Variability in NBP was largely driven by carbon input through NPP, with an increasing contribution from the response of carbon residence time to external forcing at longer timescales
On centennial timescales, preindustrial greenhouse gases were the dominant forcing of the land carbon cycle, followed by huge volcanic eruptions
